intro: Gymnadenia comigera, commonly known as the rose gentian, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family, and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and blue. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous grasslands and meadows, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lanceolate and arranged in a basal rosette, while its flowering stems are often taller than the foliage. Gymnadenia comigera is valued for its ornamental beauty and plays a role in supporting local pollinator populations.
